bibl.title: Letter from Robert E. Lee Michie to Jefferson Randolph Kean, June 27, 1900

div1.p: Michie plans on ordering cocktails and drinking to Kean's health. He also mentions a formaldehyde machine left running in a room that prevented anyone from being able to sleep in it. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Robert E. Lee Michie to Jefferson Randolph Kean, June 27, 1900
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT
OF HAVANA AND PINAR DEL RIO.
QUEMADOS.
June 27, 1900.
My dear Kean:
div1.p:
Just received your note, and sent cable as requested. Will go
up and order two cock-tails, old man, one for you and one for me,
and drink both to your health, and may you have forty more birth-
days and hereafter be able to drink your own cock-tails.

Am glad that Hepburn will be brought in with you, as it will
not be so lonely for you two. Hope to see you both out very soon.

Dunn reported day before yesterday, but has not come out for
duty yet. Intended to come out yesterday, but Field started
that darned formaldehyde machine of his upstairs, and got his room
so that no body could sleep in it, and we had to telephone him to
stay in town until today.

I will send Tester over with this note, and you can have
him attend to the errants you want.

The general joins me in greetings for the day. Will be power-
fully glad to have you back, and will tie you up if necessary
to keep you away from germs.
